pkgmetadata.longdescription: 105 Data Sets from "Introductory Econometrics: A Modern Approach" by Jeffrey M. Wooldridge // Economics students new to both Econometrics and R may find the tasks of learning both a bit daunting. However, if your text is "Introductory Econometrics: A Modern Approach" by Jeffrey M. Wooldridge, then you are in luck! The `wooldridge` data package aims to lighten the task by loading any data set from the text with a single command. In addition, the package contains documentation for each data set and all data has been efficiently compressed resulting in a total size that is 62.73% of its original. A wooldridge- vignette recreates examples from every chapter of the text, offering a relevant introduction to R's statistical model syntax. Note: Data sets are from the 5th edition (Wooldridge 2013, ISBN-13:978-1-111-53104-1), which is compatible with all other editions.
